trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error condition prevents the accessing or creation of a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class that provides a specific error condition.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the error condition.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class that provides specific <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext>.
This constructor is protected.
The data that is required to serialize or deserialize an object.
The context, including source and destination, of the serialized stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class that provides a specific error condition, including the underlying cause of the exception.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the error condition.
The underlying error condition that caused the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code, error condition, and printer name.
An <xref:System.Int32> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the error condition.
The name of the printer that was being accessed when the error occurred.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class that provides a specific printer name, error code, and error condition, including the underlying cause of the exception.
An <xref:System.Int32> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the error condition.
The name of the printer that was being accessed when the error occurred.
The underlying error condition that caused the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueueException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code, error condition, printer name, and printer message.
An <xref:System.Int32> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the error condition.
The name of the printer that was being accessed when the error occurred.
The exception message that was sent by the printer driver or unmanaged print system component that triggered the exception.
Gets the data that is used to serialize the object and gets the context of the serialized stream.
The data that is required to serialize or deserialize an object.
The context, including source and destination, of the serialized stream.
Gets the name of the printer that was being accessed when the exception was thrown.
A <xref:System.String> that names the printer.
